trial_identification.studytitle: The effects of kiwifruit on markers of cardiovascular health in men with high cholesterol levels.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The effects of kiwifruit on markers of metabolic health in men with hypercholesterolaemia.

conditions.healthcondition: Metabolic factors associated with cardiovascular risk

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Diseases of the vasculature and circulation including the lymphatic system

interventions.interventions: Four week run-in period (healthy diet based on the New Zealand food based dietary guidelines, e.g 5 servings of fruit and vegetables per day, etc.) 8-week randomised controlled cross-over study- intervention: 2 green kiwifruit/day + healthy diet (n=80); control: healthy diet + other fruit that they would normally have consumed (n=80); 4 weeks on each with no wash-out period between interventions (phase 1). Followed by a 4-week randomised parallel study- group one: 2 green kiwifruit/day + healthy diet (n=40); group two: 2 gold kiwifruit/day + healthy diet (n=40) (phase 2).
interventions.comparator: Healthy diet and other fruit they would normally have consumed.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Serum lipid profiles (serum total cholesterol, low density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C), triglycerides, high density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C), total cholesterol/HDL-C, apolipoprotein A-1 and apolipoprotein B)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline1 (beginning of 4 week run-in period), Baseline2 (4wk), 8, 12 and 16 weeks

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Haemostatic markers including plasma fibrinogen, tissue plasminogen activator activity (tPAact) and plasminogen activator inhibitor 1 activity (PAI-1)) and inflammation (C-reactive protein (CRP))
Markers of glucose metabolism (plasma glucose, serum insulin)
Effects of apolipoprotein E (apoE) genotypes on response to dietary interventions

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Men; >21 years, non-smokers, serum LDL-C>3.0mmol/L, serum triglycerides (TG) < 3.0mmol/L, prepared to eat kiwifruit and a frozen dairy product
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Smokers, using lipid lowering medication, using supplements or functional foods that will affect lipid concentrations (e.g. sterol enriched spreads), chronic disease e.g. coronary heart disease (CHD), diabetes, cancer, familial hypercholesterolaemia

trial_design.concealment: The person who will determine if a subject is eligible for inclusion in the trial will be unaware, when this decision is made, to which group the subject will be allocated. Allocation will be made by central randomisation by computer.
trial_design.sequence: Phase 1: Random assignment to 1 of 2 treatment sequences using computer generated random number tables. Phase 2: re-randomisation assignment to 1 of 2 treatment sequences using computer generated random number tables.
trial_design.designfeatures: The kiwifruit intervention will not be blinded.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Institute of Food, Nutrition and Human health Private Bag 102904 North Shore City 0745

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The study will investigate whether eating two kiwifruit a day in conjunction with a healthy diet, can lower the cholesterol of men with high cholesterol concentrations.
ethicsAndSummary.publication: Gammon, C. S., Kruger, R., Minihane, A. M., Conlon, C. A., Von von Hurst, P. R. & Stonehouse, W. (2013). Kiwifruit consumption favourably affects plasma lipids in a randomised controlled trial in hypercholesterolaemic men. British Journal of Nutrition, 109 (12), 22082218

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Massey University Human Ethics Committee (MUHEC): Southern A
